top_categories.workout_context: Eislek Gravel's Luxembourg Ardennes, European gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 70 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Eislek Gravel's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before June.
79ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Eislek Gravel, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
5,500ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Eislek Gravel. Train it until it feels boring.
70 miles on luxembourg Ardennes gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Eislek Gravel, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
5,500ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on luxembourg Ardennes gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 5,500ft of climbing on luxembourg Ardennes gravel does to your power file on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Eislek Gravel’s 70 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Eislek Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on luxembourg ardennes gravel to build confidence. Expect: luxembourg ardennes, european gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 70 miles of luxembourg ardennes gravel in Luxembourg.
